page.title: 19CALDER VALE FESTIVAL
page.content: Calder Vale Festival is held each year on the second Saturday in June. It was started again in 1969 after a gap of several years. A new Festival Queen is chosen from the last year in junior school and the first year in secondary school, and someone is invited to crown the queen on Festival Day. The day begins with the procession through the village followed by the crowning on the village green. Later there are stalls and refreshments on the village square. In the afternoon a band plays a concert while there are children's sports on the green. There is another procession through the village in the evening with a fancy dress competion. The day ends with the queens placing their flowers on the War Memorial.
